statement.tex: %text Is the binary operation * defined on set $\mathbb{N}$, given by $a*b=\dfrac{a+b}{2}\,\forall\, a, b \in\mathbb{N}$, (i) commutative? (ii) associative? % \\ %text Does the following prove that binary operator '$*$' is commutative? % \\ %text If $a*b=\dfrac{a+b}{2}$ what is $a*b-b*a$? % \\ %text Does the following prove that binary operator * is associative? % \\ %text If $a*b=\dfrac{a+b}{2}$ what is % a*(b*c)-(a*b)*c? \\

options.tex: \begin{align} a*b &= \dfrac{a+b}{2} \\ b*a&= \dfrac{b+a}{2} \\ \implies a*b&=b*a\, \forall\, a,b \in \mathbb{N} \end{align}\\ %text Therefore the operator $*$ is commutative. %
\begin{align} a*b &= \dfrac{a+b}{2} \\ b*a&= -\dfrac{b+a}{2} \\ \implies a*b&\neq b*a\, \forall\, a,b \in \mathbb{N} \end{align}\\ %text Therefore the operator $*$ is \underline{not} commutative. %

reason.tex: %text By definition of commutativity, binary operator $*$ is commutative if $a*b=b*a$ for any $a,b\in N$. % \begin{align} a*b-b*a &= \dfrac{a+b}{2}-\dfrac{b+a}{2}=0 \\ \therefore a*b&=b*a \end{align}\\ %text Therefore, the binary operator $*$ is commutative. %

options.tex: \begin{align} a*(b*c) &= \dfrac{a+\left(\dfrac{b+c}{2}\right)}{2}=\dfrac{2a+b+c}{4} \\ (a*b)*c &= \dfrac{\left(\dfrac{a+b}{2}\right)+c}{2}=\dfrac{a+b+2c}{4} \\ \end{align}\\ %text $a*(b*c)\neq (a*b)*c$ therefore the binary operator $*$ is not associative %

\begin{align} a*(b*c) &= \dfrac{a+\left(\dfrac{b+c}{2}\right)}{2}=\dfrac{2a+b+c}{4} \\ a*(c*b) &= \dfrac{a+\left(\dfrac{c+b}{2}\right)}{2}=\dfrac{2a+c+b}{4} \\ \end{align}\\ %text $a*(b*c)=a*(c*b)$ therefore the binary operator $*$ is associative %

reason.tex: %text By definition of associativity, binary operator $*$ is associative if $a*(b*c)=(a*b)*c$ for any $a,b,c\in N$. % \begin{align} a*(b*c)-(a*b)*c&=\dfrac{a+\left(\dfrac{b+c}{2}\right)}{2} -\dfrac{\left(\dfrac{a+b}{2}\right)+c}{2} \\ =\dfrac{2a+b+c}{4}&-\dfrac{a+b+2c}{4}=\dfrac{a-c}{4}\neq 0 \\ a*(b*c)&\neq(a*b)*c \end{align}\\ %text Therefore, the binary operator $*$ is \underline{not} associatative. %
